action.action-desc: Mrs. Boebert (for herself, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mr. Nehls, Mr. Gohmert, Mr. Hice of Georgia, Mr. Buck, Mr. Tiffany, and Mr. Perry) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of State to designate Afghanistan as a state sponsor of terrorism.

section.text: This Act may be cited as The Taliban Sponsor Terrorism Act.

section.header: Designation of Afghanistan as a state sponsor of terrorism
section.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of State shall designate Afghanistan as a country the government of which has repeatedly provided support for international terrorism pursuant toâ€”

paragraph.text: section 1754(c)(1)(A) of the Export Control Reform Act of 2018 (50 U.S.C. 4318(c)(1)(A));
section 620A of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2371);
section 40 of the Arms Export Control Act (22 U.S.C. 2780); and
any other applicable provision of law.
